clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of olmesaRtan on Walking distancE and quaLIty of lifE in Peripheral Artery Disease Patients With Hypertension Treated For Intermittent Claudication (RELIEF)

brief_summary.textblock: To study the effect of olmesartan on walking distance and quality of life in peripheral artery disease patients with hypertension treated For intermittent claudication.

clinical_study.why_stopped: The data of the paper referenced in the preparation of the protocols in this task were manipulated and the paper was withdrawn.

primary_outcome.measure: Pain free maximum walking distance and time
primary_outcome.description: Effect of olmesartan in maximum, pain free walking distance & time

secondary_outcome.measure: Quality of life as measured by questionnaires
secondary_outcome.description: Effect of olmesartan in quality of life (WIQ, SF-36)

other_outcome.measure: Pulse wave analysis as measured by PWV
Blood pressure by measured by 24hr ABPM

clinical_study.condition: Peripheral Artery Disease With Intermittent Claudication

arm_group.description: olmesartan (20mg qd then 40mg qd for titrating BP <140/90 mmHg)

intervention.description: CCB, diuretics, alpha blocker, direct vasodilator, beta blocker

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Aged between 20 and 85 years at visit 1
- Patients with ankle-brachial index (ABI) of less than 0.9 in one or both legs with history of intermittent claudication stable for the previous 6 months
- Patients whose statins, anti hypertensive medications and antiplatelet medications are stable for the past 6 months. Statins and cilostazol are allowed but needs to be stable for the past 6 months (diabetic medications may be changed)
- Patients whose blood pressure is more than 140/90 mmHg with/without anti-hypertension treatment
Exclusion Criteria:
- Blood pressure of more than 180/110 mmHg
- Patients taking ARBs or ACE inhibitors treatment for at least 6 months before
- Patients taking aldosterone receptor antagonists at least 6 months before
- Patients with serum creatinine of more than 3 mg/dL
- serum potassium (K+) > 5.5mg/dl
- History of bilateral renal artery stenosis
- History of acute coronary syndrome or heart failure hospitalization within 6 months
- Peripheral arterial revascularization planned within 1 month
- Critical limb ischemia
- Patients with impaired cognition (e.g. dementia)
- pregnancy or women at age of childbearing potential
